metadata.Title: CVE-2013-7437 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in potrace 1.11 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via large dimensions in a BMP image, which triggers a buffer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-7437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpotrace0 - 1.12-1
potrace - 1.12-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> inkscape in xenial and earlier embeds libpotrace (LP: #1156664) I don't see a public development tree for potrace but comment #42 of the Debian bug contains a broken out patch from the upstream potrace maintainer mdeslaur> potrace in inkscape works on bitmaps already loaded, not arbitrary images. Marking as not-affected for inkscape.

criterions.comment: potrace package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12-1').
